validationRules.fixedPos: Required when dmPosition is 'fixed', must be 'left-top', 'left-bottom', 'right-top', or 'right-bottom'
validationRules.darkIcon: FontAwesome class for dark mode, requires darkIconEn: true
validationRules.matchOsTheme: Boolean, auto-match OS dark mode setting

warnings: Don't use both matchOsTheme:true and saveCookies:true (creates conflicting behavior - choose one)
Fixed positioning (dmPosition: 'fixed') requires dmRightOf and dmBottomOf offsets
Absolute positioning requires parent container with position: relative
beforeText and afterText not visible in style-3 (icon-only mode)
darkIconEn must be true to use darkIcon attribute
switchLgtBG and switchDarkBG should have different colors for clear visual feedback
Cookie persistence requires user consent in GDPR regions
matchOsTheme works via CSS @media (prefers-color-scheme) - ensure CSS variables are set up
Don't forget to set up global color palette CSS variables for theme switching to work
Border radius 50% creates circular toggle, 0-20px creates rounded rectangle
commonMistakes: Forgetting to set openBg: 1 before defining background colors/gradients
Not providing sufficient color contrast between light and dark modes
Using fixed positioning without offset values (toggle appears at 0,0)
Setting both saveCookies and matchOsTheme (conflicts - OS theme overrides cookie)
Not testing toggle visibility on both light and dark backgrounds
Using px units for responsive sizing instead of responsive values (md/sm/xs)
Forgetting to set darkIconEn: true when using darkIcon attribute
Not setting switchSize for style-3 (results in tiny or huge icons)
Using beforeText/afterText with style-3 (text not displayed)
Not configuring CSS custom properties for theme colors (toggle works but theme doesn't change)
bestPractices: Use saveCookies: true for persistent preference across sessions
Use matchOsTheme: true for accessibility-first, OS-aware behavior
Provide clear visual distinction between light and dark states (different colors)
Use fixed positioning (right-bottom/right-top) for easy access on all pages
Set responsive sizing (md/sm/xs) for optimal mobile experience
Use sun (fas fa-sun) and moon (fas fa-moon) icons for universal recognition
Add box shadows for depth and better visibility
Use border radius 50% for classic toggle switch look
Test toggle on both light and dark page backgrounds
Consider using gradient backgrounds for premium aesthetic
Use contrasting colors: light backgrounds with dark dots (and vice versa)
Set appropriate offsets (20-40px) from edges for fixed positioning
Use typography controls for label styling consistency with site design
Always set openTypography: 1 before defining typography attributes
accessibilityNotes: matchOsTheme: true respects user's OS-level accessibility preference
Dark mode reduces eye strain in low-light environments
Ensure toggle is keyboard accessible (native HTML button behavior)
Provide sufficient color contrast in both light and dark modes (WCAG AA minimum 4.5:1)
Use aria-label for screen readers: 'Toggle dark mode' or 'Switch theme'
Avoid relying solely on color - use icons (sun/moon) for visual distinction
Test with screen readers to ensure toggle state is announced
Ensure toggle is visible and usable at 200% zoom (WCAG 1.4.4)
Use sufficient touch target size (minimum 44x44px for mobile)
Provide visual focus indicator for keyboard navigation
Consider providing text labels (beforeText/afterText) for clarity
performanceConsiderations: Cookie persistence adds minimal overhead (~100 bytes)
matchOsTheme uses CSS @media query (no JavaScript overhead)
Fixed positioning uses CSS position: fixed (GPU-accelerated)
Avoid complex gradient animations on toggle (use simple color transitions)
Use CSS transitions for smooth toggle animation (duration: 300-500ms)
Cache user preference in localStorage for instant theme application on page load
Load theme preference before page render to prevent flash of unstyled content (FOUC)
Use CSS custom properties for theme colors (efficient runtime updates)
